sub_topic: Probability of a certain outcome in a sports game
message_1: A basketball player makes 70% of their free throws. If they take 10 free throws in a game, what is the probability that they make all 10 free throws?
message_2:
To find the probability of the basketball player making all 10 free throws, we need to multiply the probability of making each individual free throw together. Since the player makes 70% of their free throws, the probability of making each free throw is 0.7.

So, the probability of making all 10 free throws is:

0.7 * 0.7 * 0.7 * 0.7 * 0.7 * 0.7 * 0.7 * 0.7 * 0.7 * 0.7 = 0.7^10 â‰ˆ 0.0282

The probability of the basketball player making all 10 free throws is approximately 2.82%.
